metadata.Title: CVE-2016-4437 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: Apache Shiro before 1.2.5, when a cipher key has not been configured for the "remember me" feature, allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or bypass intended access restrictions via an unspecified request parameter.

criterions.comment: shiro: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
